sentences.en: For them to front an evil with plain speech is to be guilty of effrontery.
sentences.cn: 对他们来说,与魔鬼开诚布公的讲话是一种厚颜无耻的罪过.

sentences.en: He admired the effrontery with which she bargained.
sentences.cn: 他挺佩服她讨价还价的那股泼辣劲.
他和颜悦色地厚着脸皮把一切都赖掉了.

sentences.en: He had the effrontery to suggest that she enjoyed being unhappy.
sentences.cn: 他无耻地大胆暗示,她喜欢不幸.

sentences.en: He was so amazed at their effrontery that he stutters in confusion.
sentences.cn: 他对他们的粗暴无礼感到非常吃惊,竟然结结巴巴,不知所措.

sentences.en: How can he have had the effrontery to say " Piss off! " to you?
sentences.cn: 他怎么会这样无耻,竟然对你 “ 滚开! ” 呢 ?

sentences.en: I'll see if you have the effrontery to face her.
sentences.cn: 我 倒 要看你怎么有脸面对她.

sentences.en: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
sentences.cn: 那人十足的厚颜无耻让人们吃惊得无话可说。

sentences.en: Only a person who is congenitally self - centered has the effrontery and the stamina to write essays.
sentences.cn: 只有生来以 自我 为中心的人才会厚颜无耻、持之以恒地去写散文.

sentences.en: That indestructible, inward effrontery in the meagre fellow was what made men so down on Michaelis.
sentences.cn: 蔑克里斯这种不可毁灭的内在的厚颜无耻,便是使男子们憎恶他的原因.

sentences.en: The man had the effrontery to be sarcastic.
sentences.cn: 那个男人有冷嘲热讽的放肆劲。

sentences.en: The politician had the effrontery to ask the people he had insulted to vote for him.
sentences.cn: 这个政客竟厚颜地要求受过他侮辱的人投他一票.

sentences.en: The weak gain strength through effrontery and the strong grow weak because of inhibitions.
sentences.cn: 弱者由于蛮干变强,强者由于克制变弱.

sentences.en: To act or speak with effrontery. Used in the imperative to express contempt or disdainful disbelief.
sentences.cn: 厚颜无耻的言行厚颜无耻地做或说. 用在祈使语气以表达鄙视或轻蔑的不信.

sentences.en: Why are you showing such effrontery?
sentences.cn: 你为什么表现的如此放肆?

sentences.en: You crashed my car and now you have the effrontery to ask me for my bicycle!
sentences.cn: 你撞坏了我的汽车,现在又厚着脸皮来借我的自行车!

trans.tran_en: rude behaviour that shocks you because it is so confident
